headline: Inlyte Energy Welcomes GE and Tesla Veterans to Leadership Team to Accelerate Commercialization
summary: Inlyte Energy, a manufacturer of iron-sodium battery energy storage systems, today announced the appointment of three executives to the company's leadership team. Sandor Hollo, former Chief Technology Officer of GE Energy Storage, joins as EVP of Product; Alison Armstrong, former manufacturing director from Tesla, joins as Head of Operations; and Dilip Goswami, former CEO of Molekule and venture partner at At One Ventures, joins as President. The new leadership appointments mark a pivotal moment

headline: Musk's Texas-sized $1 trillion payday enabled by state's new law
summary: WILMINGTON, Delaware (Reuters) -Elon Musk's blow-out $1 trillion pay package from Tesla proves everything is bigger in Texas, especially under its new management-friendly law.  Last year, Tesla reincorporated in the Lone Star State after a judge in its former corporate home, Delaware, ruled a $56 billion compensation for the CEO was "unfathomable" and unfair to shareholders.  Musk urged companies to ditch Delaware and his board worked on a new pay package.
